alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 08 at 10:23AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: .Warm temperatures may melt snowpack and increase stream flows out of the Bears Paw Mountains and tributaries feeding the Milk River. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following areas, Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine, Eastern Toole and Liberty, Hill County, Northern Blaine County and Western and Central Chouteau County. * WHEN...From 3 PM MDT this afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, especially for tributaries of the Milk River draining the Bears Paw Mountains and vicinity, including Big Sandy Creek and Clear Creek. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County
